description: Manage CUPS queues and default options via the CUPS command line utilities.

providers.doc:
This provider manages installed printers using CUPS command line tools

  The provider is developed under Mac OS X but is intended to work with any unix/linux distribution
  supported by CUPS.

  The device uri isn't validated as the provider doesn't determine which uri's are available.
  You will need to check that your uri is valid. You can get a list of valid uri's by executing:

  $ lpinfo -v

  See the lpinfo(8) man page for more detail.

  The PPD file location reported by cups might have been changed by cups (depending on the -m model option or -P ppd
  option, so it's difficult to identify whether our changes have taken effect. These parameters will only be set on
  creation (for the moment).
  

Required binaries: `/usr/sbin/lpadmin`, `/usr/bin/lpoptions`, `/usr/bin/lpstat`.
providers.name: cups

properties.doc: The basic property that the resource should be in.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: Sets the device-uri attribute of the printer destination.
properties.name: uri

properties.doc: Provides a textual description of the destination.
properties.name: description

properties.doc: Provides a textual location of the destination.
properties.name: location

properties.doc:
Sets a standard System V interface script or PPD file for the printer from the model directory.

    Use the -m option with the lpinfo(8) command to get a list of supported models.
properties.name: model

properties.doc: Specifies a PostScript Printer Description file to use with the printer.
properties.name: ppd

properties.doc: Enables the destination and accepts jobs  Valid values are `true`, `false`.
properties.name: enabled

properties.doc: Specifies whether the destination will accept jobs, or reject them.  Valid values are `true`, `false`.
properties.name: accept

parameters.doc: The name of the printer, any character except SPACE, TAB, / or #, Not case sensitive
parameters.name: name

parameters.doc: Sets the destination to shared/published or unshared/unpublished.  Valid values are `true`, `false`.
parameters.name: shared

parameters.doc: Sets a list of PPD options for the printer
parameters.name: options

types.doc: Manage installed printers and printer queues on a puppet node.
types.name: printer

providers.doc:
This provider manages default printer options by executing lpoptions(1) as the root user.

  The root options are saved under /etc/cups/lpoptions.

  Note: On Mac OS X the default lpoptions do not correlate with the print dialog. The default printer and default media
  are selected by ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.print.PrintingPrefs.plist (10.6) and submitted with the job options.

  Classes are parsed as normal printer destinations at the moment, and are interpreted as such.
  

Required binaries: `/usr/bin/lpoptions`.
providers.name: cups_options

properties.doc: The basic property that the resource should be in.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The default value of the option being set.
properties.name: value

parameters.doc: The name of the option to set the default for.
parameters.name: name

types.doc: Sets the global defaults for all printers on the system.
types.name: printer_defaults

summary: Manage printers and printer default options in CUPS
author: mosen
name: mosen-cups
